intro: Leucadendron conchiforme, commonly known as the silver coneflower, is a striking shrub native to South Africa. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and showy, cone-shaped inflorescences that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant belongs to the family Asteraceae and is well adapted to dry, sunny environments. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Leucadendron conchiforme is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
